decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings.  Policy H8 Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 5.9 2nd deposit Unitary Development Plan. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area.  Policy H8 Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 5.9 | The proposed first floor window in the rear elevation of the extension shall contain only obscure glass and shall be so retained permanently.  REASON: To protect neighbours' privacy. Policy H8 Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 5.9
